pullRequest.body:
This adds commutative versions of the existing `NonUnital(Semi)NormedRing` classes. This is essential for talking about, for example, non-unital commutative Câ‹†-algebras.

---

nodes.body: !bench

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/24ff7b2e-f769-43e4-853a-c6ec30edbdb8) for commit c9da01e2d1f576f179111c16eb3e7e89734aa9db.
There were [significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/ebc9c472-682d-474e-aeb2-3e2815d99484/to/24ff7b2e-f769-43e4-853a-c6ec30edbdb8) against commit b70e89f1d6f77395ddcca092868695f8c2e66041:
```diff
  Benchmark                                                    Metric         Change
  ==================================================================================
- ~Mathlib.Analysis.Calculus.ContDiff.Basic                    instructions     3.5%
- ~Mathlib.Analysis.Calculus.FDeriv.Mul                        instructions     3.6%
- ~Mathlib.Analysis.InnerProductSpace.Basic                    instructions     3.3%
- ~Mathlib.Geometry.Manifold.Algebra.LeftInvariantDerivation   instructions     9.5%
```
I ran the benchmark just to be sure, but I don't consider the results damning.
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/af00fda7-51fe-4fc0-94da-bba7cb363727) for commit b6262bfb209aed6e523d5a3f6c7cf00b23c91e49.
There were [significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/ebc9c472-682d-474e-aeb2-3e2815d99484/to/af00fda7-51fe-4fc0-94da-bba7cb363727) against commit b70e89f1d6f77395ddcca092868695f8c2e66041:
```diff
  Benchmark                                                    Metric                 Change
  ==========================================================================================
- build                                                        .olean serialization     5.2%
- build                                                        import                   5.7%
- open Mathlib                                                 instructions             6.1%
- open Mathlib                                                 task-clock              41.5%
- open Mathlib                                                 wall-clock               9.3%
- ~Mathlib.Analysis.Calculus.ContDiff.Basic                    instructions             3.4%
- ~Mathlib.Analysis.Calculus.FDeriv.Mul                        instructions             3.5%
- ~Mathlib.Analysis.InnerProductSpace.Basic                    instructions             3.2%
- ~Mathlib.Analysis.NormedSpace.Multilinear                    instructions             4.4%
- ~Mathlib.Geometry.Manifold.Algebra.LeftInvariantDerivation   instructions             8.9%
```

@YaelDillies well, I have no idea what the `import Mathlib` issues are about, but otherwise it looks pretty similar. But maybe this is because the `to` instances I used are using `with` under the hood (most of this file does).
I've reverted the test.

Let's merge as is but ping @eric-wieser in case he understands why the test was not much better.

maintainer merge
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by YaelDillies.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7242283820/job/19727504448)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7242283820/job/19727504314)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7242283820/job/19727504582)
Does the benchmark get much better if you eliminate the `{ Î² with }` in favor of direct parent definitions? If not, I am happy to merge as is.

bors merge

I think the `with` version is better from a maintenance point of view anyway, and we should be fixing the performance issues upstream or with flat structures.
Does the benchmark get much better if you eliminate the `{ Î² with }` in favor of direct parent definitions? If not, I am happy to merge as is.

bors merge

I think the `with` version is better from a maintenance point of view anyway, and we should be fixing the performance issues upstream or with flat structures.

eg
```suggestion
    [Î² : NonUnitalNormedCommRing Î±] : NonUnitalSeminormedCommRing Î± where
  toNonUnitalSeminormedRing :=
    NonUnitalNormedCommRing.toNonUnitalNormedRing.toNonUnitalSeminormedRing
  mul_comm := mul_comm
```
Good point, I'll try it.

Is there a reason not to write
```suggestion
class NonUnitalNormedCommRing (Î± : Type*) extends NonUnitalNormedRing Î±, NonUnitalSeminormedCommRing Î± where
```
(other than the line length limit!)
Ah, I guess this matches the ones below

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: define `NonUnital(Semi)NormedCommRing`
